intro: Silene lasiopetala, commonly known as the woolly catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and the plant is often found in open, sunny environments. Silene lasiopetala is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural and ecological traits.
